value.0:
Step 1: A DM stands next to the creature of your choice and uses this widget. The skin and the portrait of the creature are stored on the item.

Step 2: Make sure you are not polymorphed or using an alternate appearance.

Step 3: The DM gives you the item, which you use once to store your skin and portrait on the widget. Your character will be saved. 

From now on you can use the Skin Changer to... *drumroll* ...change your skin and portrait.

There are now extra features (these must be done by the DM before handing the item to the player):

pc_vfx can be applied as an integer to the skin widget to change the polymorph visual when transforming. Apply this by using the console command dm_setvarint pc_vfx x and then target the widget, where x is the number of the visual.

pc_sfx1 (up tp pc_sfx3) can be applied to the skin widget as a string to add a sound effect when transforming. Apply this by using the console command dm_setvarint pc_sfx1 x and then target the widget, where x is the number of the sound.

A delay can be applied to the widget so it takes x amount of seconds before the target changes. Apply this by using the console command dm_setvarfloat delay 6.0 and then target the widget. This would add a delay of 6.0 seconds.
